dateline.date: after CD's move to Devonshire Terrace in December 1839, but before Thomson's move to Scotland in 1841.| Sunday Morning

body.p: Mr Charles Dickens presents his compliments to Doctor Thomson, and begs to recommend to him Mr Alfred Collinson, Alfred Collinson (1815-72); obtained licence from the Society of Apothecaries 1839; MRCS 1842; MD Aberdeen 1856. a young gentleman who is a candidate for the situation of apothecary to the Holloway and North London Dispensary.The Holloway and North Islington Dispensary, founded as a charitable dispensary in 1821; new premises opened 1840 in Francis Place, Holloway. CD naming is inaccurate. Mr Dickens owes a great many apologies to Dr Thomson for giving him this trouble, but as he is interested in Mr Collinson's success,It is not known whether Collinson was appointed. and is quite sure that the gentlemen with whom the choice rests have no wishes but to appoint a deserving and clever young man, he ventures to hope that Dr Thomson will excuse him.
